intro: Draba mieheorum, commonly known as the Mieheli's rockcress, is a flowering plant species native to the alpine regions of Central Asia. It is a small, herbaceous annual or biennial plant characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, where it thrives in cold, dry conditions. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in mountainous areas of countries such as Kazakhstan and Kyrgyzstan. Draba mieheorum is part of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures and seed dispersal mechanisms.
